items.title: Chelsea-interim blikt terug op 'bizarre' 24 uur na ontslag Maresca
items.summary: Calum McFarlane staat zondag voor de grootste opgave uit zijn trainerscarri√®re. De veertigjarige Engelsman is tegen Manchester City de eindverantwoordelijke op de bank van Chelsea, dat donderdag manager Enzo Maresca op straat zette. McFarlane beschouwt het duel met The Citizens niet als een auditie om de nieuwe manager van The Blues te worden.

Have you seen the stats of the game? You must have been watching a different game then. There was no onslaught. ‚ÄúYes, we had moments, of course. We had moments the other way. I would never describe it as that. If it was an onslaught, I‚Äôd give you my opinion and say, ‚ÄòYes, I thought it was‚Äô. Continue reading...

items.title: Arne Slot not looking at title race and calls Liverpool‚Äôs season a ‚Äòconstant battle‚Äô
items.summary: ‚ÄòEvery single game we play it‚Äôs hard work,‚Äô says Slot Liverpool fourth before trip to Fulham on Sunday Arne Slot has described Liverpool‚Äôs first half of the season as a ‚Äúconstant battle‚Äù and admitted the title race appeared to be a straight fight between Arsenal and Manchester City. The Premier League champions are 12 points adrift of Mikel Arteta‚Äôs leaders after a goalless draw with Leeds on New Year‚Äôs Day. Liverpool are unbeaten in eight matches and back in the Champions League places after recovering from the club‚Äôs worst run in 71 years, yet remain unconvincing. items.title: Heerenveen dicht bij impuls: Genk-aanvaller op weg naar Friesland
items.summary: SC Heerenveen gaat zich, mits de formaliteiten afgerond worden, spoedig versterken met Luca Oyen (22). De buitenspeler moet overkomen van RC Genk. Enkel een medische keuring scheidt de Belg nog van een transfer naar de Eredivisie.

items.title: Palace latest: Eagles close to completing ¬£35m Johnson deal
Africa Cup of Nations: tie-by-tie analysis of the last-16 matches | Osasu Obayiuwana
items.summary: After a group stage that delivered an average of 3.6 goals a game we look at the match-ups in Morocco that start on Saturday Senegal, winners of the Afcon in 2022, have arguably the best collection of players, including the experience of Sadio Man√© and the explosive talent of Nicolas Jackson, and are superior to their east African opponents. But Sudan, who qualified for the tournament despite the tragedy of a horrendous war in their country, certainly match the Lions of Teranga in fortitude. Sudan, coached by the Ghanaian Kwesi Appiah, who led his home country at the 2014 World Cup in Brazil, played all their qualifiers away from home, with the war, which began in April 2023, shutting down a thriving domestic league. The Sudan striker John Mano told the BBC of people back home: ‚ÄúSome of them cannot watch the matches ‚Ä¶ They can‚Äôt even listen on the radio ‚Ä¶ We are trying to free our country, through the football way.‚Äù A win for Sudan would be one of the fairytales of the tournament. Continue reading...
